answers.answer: I did! Only by a week, even tho we concived "on time"! Anyway, now im 32weeks and meassuring two weeks ahead... no rules but i heard some other mums were in the same situation...

Im 32wks now and at 31wks i was told i was measuring at 37wks.my baby is well over average size and i also have alot of fluid around her.i had to be checked for gestational diabetes yesterday and of that comes back normal then it means theres other bigger problems for me.im also b rhesus neg so it could mean my blood is attacking the babys blood which is not good at all! I will find out on tuesday.

I did back in 2010 before I had my daughter. I was like 1-2 weeks behind. Doctor sumed it up to a small baby. She was born at 37.2weeks and weighed 7lb 11oz and 20.5 inches long and perfectly healthy.

I was told for the first time a couple of days ago, it was the first time I was actually measured though. I'm 36+6 today, she said I'm measuring about 32wks so sent me for an ultrasound yesterday. Tech said everything looks fine with growth and exact measurements will go to Dr next wk. So looks like everything is fine, my first two were 6lb 12 and 7lb 11, and both overdue so no hope here for an early or smallish baby lol

I'm due tommarow and my tummy measures 7 inches off but the baby on the ultrasound is mesuring 7.5 and they said he's healthy so I guess it just depends on your body stucture and if your body stretches? My first son I was measured way under but he came out to be 8 1/2 pounds and 23 inches. Hes healthy too.just long and thin
I was 37 weeks but was measuring 35 weeks so he scheduled me an ultrasound to see how big my baby was and to my surprise my baby was 7 pounds even there is no telling how big she is now

question: I would like to hear stories and outcomes. Thank you :)
title: anyone else been told that they are measuring behind?
